conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric render: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness, corners, and interior volume; clean angled view and cutaway. Minor simplification of some wall edges/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Core spaces (living/dining, kitchen, toilet, bedroom) generally match adjacency and placement. However, the balcony shown in 2D is not represented as a distinct exterior space, and the utility area is not clearly separated/defined as in the plan. Some wall lengths/proportions appear generalized.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (sofa, table, bed) and bathroom fixtures included; kitchen cabinetry/sink present. Some items are simplified and not fully aligned to the exact 2D furnishing arrangement.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with clear wall/floor separation and minimal artifacts; lighting supports visibility. Openings/door details are somewhat simplified, reducing structural legibility versus the 2D plan.

detected_errors.description: Balcony space from the 2D plan is not clearly modeled as a distinct exterior/balcony area in the 3D render, affecting layout fidelity.
Utility area separation/definition does not clearly match the 2D plan (appears merged/simplified into back-of-kitchen/service zone).
Door/window placements and opening geometries are simplified; not all openings visible in the 2D plan are clearly represented in the 3D view.

summary: A valid and clean 3D cutaway conversion with strong fundamentals, but with notable layout fidelity loss due to the missing/unclear balcony and simplified utility/opening geometry.
